Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Advocate \Ad"vo*cate\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Advocated}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Advocating}.] [See {Advocate}, n., {Advoke}, {Avow}.] To plead in favor of; to defend by argument, before a tribunal or the public; to support, vindicate, or recommend publicly. [1913 Webster]
To advocate the cause of thy client. --Bp. Sanderson (1624). [1913 Webster]
This is the only thing distinct and sensible, that has been advocated. --Burke. [1913 Webster]
Eminent orators were engaged to advocate his cause. --Mitford. [1913 Webster]
